column4: I need help with the ln command,  after linking the directory doesn't apper correct
help:  I did a ln -s /var/www/lighttpd/ ~/Documents/local_html/ ;  then ls ~/var/www/lightppd  but found 0 documents
sorry:  I did a ln -s /var/www/lighttpd/ ~/Documents/local_html/ ;  then ls /var/www/lightppd/  but found 0 documents (local_html is populated)
ln -s TARGET LINKNAME, you reversed the arguments.
but if I ls ~/Documents/local_public  I get a list of my documents
do I need to remove the link somehow? I didn't see a -r
unlink
ok,, I'll try it
I get an error cannot unlink ...local_html/ is a directory
Then you didn't create the link when you did your command.
ok, so I redid it as you said, and it sorta worked, when I ls /var/www/lighttpd/  I get 1 directory called local_html/
I'll play aroudn with it, I must have left off a /
thanks
I keep getting a subdirectory of local_html/ that contains myfiles
The linkname needs to not exist before you do your command
should I delete the directory /var/www/lighttpd/ ?
Is that where you want the link to be? If so, yes.
that did it thanks!
you're welcome
my php
my php's variable SERVER_ROOT needed to not be in a subdirectory, so I figured I could do a link and then switch out multiple php apps that all want to be root
I mean my php app need to think it was in the root because of hardcoded stupidity
